Name: Seated statue of Merimose
Description: Dressed in a long, tight-fitting cloak, Merimose is sitting on a tall narrow stool, the back of which narrows into an inscribed back pillar. Merimose's wig is falling over his shoulders. He is wearing a broad collar and his arms are decorated with numerous armlets and bracelets. His right hand is flat on his thigh, and the left hand is clasping a towel. Despite the slight damage to the face, it conveys a lively and even individual expression. The inscriptions on the front of the cloak, the back pillar, and the sides of the seat contain the offering formula as well as the name and titles of Merimose. The same individual was the owner of Theban Tomb no. 383.
